H0.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 1

H1.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 2

H2.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 4

H3.text: What is the maximum number of points that can be scored from a single shot in basketball. 3

A4.text: If a player completed a three-pointer while being fouled, and that foul was ruled as either a Flagrant 1 or a Flagrant 2 foul, the player would be awarded two free throws for a possible 5-point play.

A5.text: If a shooter is fouled while attempting a three-pointer and subsequently misses the shot, the shooter is awarded three free-throw attempts.

A6.text: A successful shot is worth two points, or three points if it is taken from beyond the three-point arc 6.75 meters (22 ft 2 in) from the basket in international games and 23 feet 9 inches (7.24 m) in NBA games.

A7.text: The BIG3 features several rule variants including a four-point field goal.

A8.text: A field goal can be worth four points in the BIG3 basketball league.

A9.text: A field goal is worth two or three points depending on the location of the attempt on the basket.

A10.text: If a player makes a shot while being fouled, the number of free throws is reduced to one, and the basket counts.

A11.text: If a player misses the shot during the foul, the player receives either two or three free throws depending on whether the shot was taken in front of or behind the three-point line.
